verses.plain: Canst thou draw out leviathan with an hook? or his tongue with a cord which thou lettest down?

tokens.t: Canst thou draw out leviathan with an hook? or his tongue with a cord
thou lettest down?

verses.plain: Canst thou put an hook into his nose? or bore his jaw through with a thorn?

tokens.t: Canst thou put an hook into his nose? or bore his jaw through with a thorn?

verses.plain: Will he make many supplications unto thee? will he speak soft words unto thee?

tokens.t: Will he make many supplications unto thee? will he speak soft
unto thee?

verses.plain: Will he make a covenant with thee? wilt thou take him for a servant for ever?

tokens.t: Will he make a covenant with thee? wilt thou take him for a servant for ever?

verses.plain: Wilt thou play with him as with a bird? or wilt thou bind him for thy maidens?

tokens.t: Wilt thou play with him as
a bird? or wilt thou bind him for thy maidens?

verses.plain: Shall the companions make a banquet of him? shall they part him among the merchants?

tokens.t: Shall the companions make a banquet of him? shall they part him among the merchants?

verses.plain: Canst thou fill his skin with barbed irons? or his head with fish spears?

tokens.t: Canst thou fill his skin with barbed irons? or his head with fish spears?

verses.plain: Lay thine hand upon him, remember the battle, do no more.

tokens.t: Lay thine hand upon him, remember the battle, do no more.

verses.plain: Behold, the hope of him is in vain: shall not one be cast down even at the sight of him?

tokens.t: Behold, the hope of him is in vain: shall not
be cast down even at the sight of him?

verses.plain: None is so fierce that dare stir him up: who then is able to stand before me?

tokens.t: None
fierce that dare stir him up: who then is able to stand before me?

verses.plain: Who hath prevented me, that I should repay him? whatsoever is under the whole heaven is mine.

tokens.t: Who hath prevented me, that I should repay
under the whole heaven is mine.

verses.plain: I will not conceal his parts, nor his power, nor his comely proportion.

tokens.t: I will not conceal his parts, nor his power, nor his comely proportion.

verses.plain: Who can discover the face of his garment? or who can come to him with his double bridle?

tokens.t: Who can discover the face of his garment?
who can come
with his double bridle?

verses.plain: Who can open the doors of his face? his teeth are terrible round about.

tokens.t: Who can open the doors of his face? his teeth
terrible round about.

verses.plain: His scales are his pride, shut up together as with a close seal.

tokens.t: scales
pride, shut up together
a close seal.

verses.plain: One is so near to another, that no air can come between them.

tokens.t: One is so near to another, that no air can come between them.

verses.plain: They are joined one to another, they stick together, that they cannot be sundered.

tokens.t: They are joined one to another, they stick together, that they cannot be sundered.

verses.plain: By his neesings a light doth shine, and his eyes are like the eyelids of the morning.

tokens.t: By his neesings a light doth shine, and his eyes
like the eyelids of the morning.

verses.plain: Out of his mouth go burning lamps, and sparks of fire leap out.

tokens.t: Out of his mouth go burning lamps,
sparks of fire leap out.

verses.plain: Out of his nostrils goeth smoke, as out of a seething pot or caldron.

tokens.t: Out of his nostrils goeth smoke, as
of a seething pot or caldron.

verses.plain: His breath kindleth coals, and a flame goeth out of his mouth.

tokens.t: His breath kindleth coals, and a flame goeth out of his mouth.

verses.plain: In his neck remaineth strength, and sorrow is turned into joy before him.

tokens.t: In his neck remaineth strength, and sorrow is turned into joy before him.

verses.plain: The flakes of his flesh are joined together: they are firm in themselves; they cannot be moved.

tokens.t: The flakes of his flesh are joined together: they are firm in themselves; they cannot be moved.

verses.plain: His heart is as firm as a stone; yea, as hard as a piece of the nether millstone.

tokens.t: His heart is as firm as a stone; yea, as hard as a piece of the nether

verses.plain: When he raiseth up himself, the mighty are afraid: by reason of breakings they purify themselves.

tokens.t: When he raiseth up himself, the mighty are afraid: by reason of breakings they purify themselves.

verses.plain: The sword of him that layeth at him cannot hold: the spear, the dart, nor the habergeon.

tokens.t: The sword of him that layeth at him cannot hold: the spear, the dart, nor the habergeon.

verses.plain: He esteemeth iron as straw, and brass as rotten wood.

tokens.t: He esteemeth iron as straw,
brass as rotten wood.

verses.plain: The arrow cannot make him flee: slingstones are turned with him into stubble.

tokens.t: The arrow cannot make him flee: slingstones are turned with him into stubble.

verses.plain: Darts are counted as stubble: he laugheth at the shaking of a spear.

tokens.t: Darts are counted as stubble: he laugheth at the shaking of a spear.

verses.plain: Sharp stones are under him: he spreadeth sharp pointed things upon the mire.

tokens.t: Sharp stones
under him: he spreadeth sharp pointed things upon the mire.

verses.plain: He maketh the deep to boil like a pot: he maketh the sea like a pot of ointment.

tokens.t: He maketh the deep to boil like a pot: he maketh the sea like a pot of ointment.

verses.plain: He maketh a path to shine after him; one would think the deep to be hoary.

tokens.t: He maketh a path to shine after him;
would think the deep
hoary.

verses.plain: Upon earth there is not his like, who is made without fear.

tokens.t: Upon earth there is not his like, who is made without fear.

verses.plain: He beholdeth all high things: he is a king over all the children of pride.

tokens.t: He beholdeth all high
he
a king over all the children of pride.

footnotes.text: leviathan: probably an extinct animal of some kind
scales: Heb. strong pieces of shields
is turned into joy: Heb. rejoiceth
Sharp stones: Heb. Sharp pieces of potsherd
is made without fear: or, behave themselves without fear
